column176: 1) Please describe your level of vision.

column4: Recent research is trying to figure out how to make images accessible.
column10: Is the turkey cooked? Are there other people at the table?
column13: Slightly more info could be helpful, but not too much more
column19: What does this have to do with the article? Why is it included? Seems vague and unnecessary
column22: Seems like an unnecessary addition to the article
column28: What is the statue of? What cathedral is it?
column29: Simple and concise with multiple references to the surroundings
column30: Not detailed enough to really feel like you are there, but simple enough where it isn't confusing
column31: A bit more description of the layout or detail would be helpful
column38: Detailed enough with exactly how the roof is shaped
column40: Helpful to understand type of material so I can picture the environment
column46: What does the church have to do with the article? What is it made of? What type of architecture is it?
column47: Helpful to know it is a church...started the visualization
column48: Unnecessary, provided not extra value to understanding the article/image
column55: Confidence in type of room, how large the windows are, more specifics on what type of windows they are
column56: included how the windows close, number of windows
column64: Are they talking? Are they independently working? How many people?
column65: The word 'around' helps me visualize; same with including laptops and plural 'people'
column66: A little too vague in terms of the 'why' this is included
column73: What does this have to do with hair? Why is this image included?
column74: Colors are very helpful, variety of people is helpful
column75: Ha dnothing to do with the content of the article, but great visual
column82: Is orogeny the cause of the image? Is that a result of the erosion? What is the significance of the image?
column83: Descriptive and concise, allows me to picture it, talks about the foreground and background
column84: Does not perfectly explain why it is included...it seems more random than intentional inclusion to the orogeny context
column91: If the article is about interior design, what is the aesthetic significance of the room described? It simply explains, but provides no context on what is most pleasing
column92: Compelled to visualize the setting, but no clue on type of couch, type of table, how many people
column93: Not too helpful to capture the value of interior design
column100: Is there a certain culture trying to be highlighted? Certain type of food?
column101: The way things are described as left, right, middle is very helpful; number of people; location
column102: Is there anything contextually that would be helpful to share?
column109: Why is this here? What is it trying to highlight? How does this help illustrate the type of environment described?
column110: I can visualize it because of the value of mountains, what's on them
column111: More detail would help even if colors or size is added
column118: Who is playing them? Are they being strum? Does the person have a guitar pic in hand?
column120: Way too vague...adds nothing to my reading. The article excerpt was more helpful in visualizing than the image itself
column127: What does this have to do with consumer electronics?
column128: Number of people, perceived gender, scenery around them, what they are doing, facial expression
column136: How many players? What are they celebrating? ow are they expressing celebration?
column137: Helpful to know they are soccer players
column138: How can we assume they are celebrating? What signals that?
column145: Is there particular furniture to highlight?
column146: Surroundings, number of people, colors, what they are doing
column147: The article is about furniture. Are we missing some element of explaining that?
column154: What does the ad say? What colors are on the ad?
column155: Soccer field reference is helpful, billboard is helpful
column156: Does not deepen my understanding of the ad presented
column164: Very detailed and highlights what is emphasized - the turkey, centerpiece, and silverware
column172: What colors are involved? Is there anything surrounding the river?
column173: Flowing across the land is helpful verbiage
column174: I cannot visualize it because it sounds more fake than real description of a picture
column177: Always (More than 95% of the time you use computers)
column183: The question around was the information enough was unclear because no, just right implies that is captured the info correctly, but some were very descriptive, but had nothing to do with the article
